comment._content: Perhaps from the arrival in NYC described in query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D06E5D61630E233A... "TITTA RUFFO HERE FOR AMERICAN DEBUT; $2,000 Baritone Says the Art of Song Is Declining in Italy -- Likes Shakespearean Roles. October 29, 1912, The steamship George Washington brought in several important additions to the operatic forces in America yesterday. Its passenger list included the names of Titta Ruffo, the $2,000 baritone, and Lucrezia Bori, the Spanish soprano. Besides Ruffo there were three other baritones on board -- Antonio Scotti, Pasquale Amato, and William Hinshaw."
